p: From the ancient times, people have used medicinal plants as a potential source of life for the recuperation from major and minor ailments (Hussain et al., 2018). Momordica charantia (MC) also commonly known as bitter melon, bitter apple, bitter gourd or karela, belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae (Yoshime et al., 2016). Contemporary scientific research has proven that bitter melon auspiciously possesses different pharmacological activities including antidiabetic, anticancer, antimicrobial, anti-hepatotoxic, antioxidant, antiviral, antiulcerogenic, and larvicidal activities (Anjum et al., 2012).
